intro: Silene renzii var. khorassanica, commonly known as the Khorassan catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. It has hairy stems and leaves that are usually opposite in arrangement. Silene renzii var. khorassanica is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
